text: Absolutely amazing people. I'm a framer who has decided to roof their own shop. Show up for my materials and start chatting with the gentleman helping to load my trailer. Let him know I've not done this before and he spends about 30 minutes teaching me the ins and outs of metal roofing, while walking about the facility and showing me examples of how to trim. He notices I've missed some trim pieces that I could have purchased from them- then he tells me how to do a professional job without those exact pieces (talked me out of buying more product). Went in to buy the trim pieces, since I intend to not get a hard time from my wife, and find out the gal ringing me up was the guy's wife. Same story- spent extra time to make sure I got the correct sealant strip and she even put one of the two I had selected back, as I didn't need that quantity. Keep in mind, I spent less than $450. Drive the distance if you need to, this is the only place to buy metal roofing.

name: Bob Sancken
text:
Testimonial for K & G Metals

This Spring I had the pleasure of getting a carport put up by K+G Metals. What I ended up with was a structure considerably nicer than the standard”rounded eaves”carports that you see all over. Glynn(who’s family owns the business) was my”Low Pressure”sales person,who remained completely calm as I changed my mind 3-4 times.LOL I ended up with building with regular looking eves with overhang. I ended up having 3 sides closed in. I had contacted 3-4 other places and was left with little reassurance that they would even show up,and they all wanted the spot to be level within 3-4 inches,my spot was sloping at least 12 inches,I explained this to Glynn and he compensated for it”no problem”. So far a”smooth talker”could have led me along,now it’s time to actually build something. The crew,Alben and Richard showed up early with a nice”business looking”rig:a nice heavy duty pickup with a nice trailer,not a”Rag-Tag”looking outfit. All of their cordless tools were Milwaukee brand and neatly stowed. They snapped a chalk line for the screws and did a great job”boxing in”the corners and enclosing the the far end. Yes, I spent a little more than I had planned but not much. What I ended up with looks pretty much like a garage,not something you bought at a farm store to put hay in. Bob,very happy customer in New Market.

resp.text: Bob, you are so kind! Thank you for your awesome review. It was a pleasure doing business with you!!

text: Great customer service and quality roofing. John was my point of contact throughout and was always quick to respond and address any questions or concerns I had. Even after the roof was on, John followed up to make sure everything went smoothly and sent a crew out to address a few areas. Cardinal saved me money, came out within a week to install my new roof, stayed in constant contact, and made sure I was satisfied with the end result before calling it finished. Reasonable, fair, and high quality. Thank you Cardinal

name: Josh Smith
text:
I have used Cardinal for two roof replacements.  It has been an excellent experience.  Very easy to work with them.  Work was completed quickly and on time.  Clean up afterwards has been excellent each time.  I have recommended them to others in the past and would do so again.

First roof was replaced summer of 2017.
Second roof was replaced summer of 2019.

Of note - THESE WERE DIFFERENT HOUSES.  The first one did not need to be replaced within 2 years.

Jason Smith was the claims specialist on each occasion, and he was very professional throughout.  He explained the process each time and was thorough each time.

name: Joseph Baskin
text: Daniel helped me with the purchase of my new roof. He was very knowledgeable of the available roofing products and insurance claims. He helped me through the entire process and even checked in during the installation to check the progress and confirm the details we discussed with the installer. He was mindful of my budget and was able to offer a range of suggestions. I am very happy with the work done. The roof looks great and we ordered a special order color. We had to have a second visit due to damage by another contractor and Cardinal was quick to resolve the issue. Also, they did an excellent job cleaning up after the job. They used a magnet around the house to clean up the old roofing nails... twice.

name: Stephen Cunning Jr
text: By far the best Roofing Experience I've had in 30 years of home ownership. They were punctual with quick, high quality work and provided a great price. I highly recommend them.

name: Michael Murry
text: Jonathan was excellent in his communication about the process and their products, while also coordinating with insurance and the roofers to get my roof replaced in a very timely manner without any incidence or concern. After the roof was complete, I had multiple contacts from Jonathan to ensure my satisfaction and to answer any questions I may have. As someone who is accustomed to the construction industry, I highly recommend Cardinal roofing for your roofing needs if you are looking for competent and trustworthy professionals.

name: C J
text: Jonathan really knows all of the ins and outs of this business. He works nonstop to please the customers and takes time from his personal life to visit during hours that is convenient to the customer. He is a rock star! The roofers that put the roof on are from another planet! They magically took off a roof and put another one on before the sun began to set. My husband is hard to impress, but dang if he didn’t comment on how fast they work to get it done! Do it! You won’t regret it.

name: Amanda Harmon
text: We are very happy with our new roof. David Dailey was prompt and professional. He kept in touch to let me know of any changes in our installation date. They were able to complete the roof in one day. Cardinal cleaned up all materials and even came back the next day to make certain no nails were left behind. I would recommend Cardinal Roofing to anyone looking at repairing or replacing their roof. Call David Dailey. He was wonderful to work with.

name: Bryan Whitehouse
text: I contracted Cardinal Roofing about two years ago to replace my Roof due to some storm damage. The process was extremely easy with my cardinal rep and they worked directly with my insurance company to setup the replacement And handle the paperwork. I’ve never had a roof replaced and I was worried that the replacement would take 5-7 days like my Next door neighbors roof. However cardinal’s crew finished my roof within 24 hours (start to finish). Let me say my roof is huge so I was shocked. This part was the bonus the benefits for me was speed, warranty and the product used.  I was so impressed I recommended to my neighbors to uses them (four) and each of them had nothing but good things to say about their work and quality. So if you’re looking at a replacement i would encourage you to speak to these folks first. Sincerely BRYAN in Hoover Alabama

name: Megan Morton
text: Cardinal Roofing recently replaced our roof in Pelham and did a fabulous job. Very professional, friendly, and efficient staff. Ryan was super nice and so easy to work with. He was very accommodating to our work schedules and he also gave us step by step before, during, and after the job. He then followed up to be sure we were satisfied with the job and answered last minute questions.  The clean up crew was also awesome! Matt did an wonderful job cleaning up our property. He made sure all nails and any evidence of them being there was taken care. He even blew off the whole yard and driveway for me. I definitely give this company a fully satisfied 5 stars 😁👌🤗

name: Susan Lee
text: I called and had to leave a message and heard back from someone the next morning.  Sales rep came out and needed to send someone to get on the roof to determine the quote.  After waiting 5 days from initial call, the worker came out and got on the roof and then left.  I did not hear back from the rep, so two days later I called them.  The rep was not aware the worker had even been out and assured me he would call back with a quote that day.  That was a week after the initial call.  I never heard from him again.  Later that day I called another company and they came out the next morning and fixed the issue.  I waited a full week for Cardinal to call me back so I could inform them that it was already fixed another week passed (2 weeks from initial call) and no one has called back with a quote or any other contact.  It was an easy fix, took the other company less than 30 min to fix.  Poor service.  I did call the office today and spoke to the manager and he has assured me they will do more training with my sales rep to ensure better service.

name: Ashton Horton
text: Cardinal Roofing were great to work with. Very quick and knowledgeable. I am a young home owner and was honestly putting off replacing my roof because it seemed more daunting then it had to be. Ryan and his team helped me through the entire process. Literally put my roof on in a day, when I’ve had neighbors with teams working for a week. If you are looking for fast, friendly, reliable service give Ryan a call!

name: jonah allen
text: I had gotten approval from my insurance to replace mu roof and was hesitant on who to call, trust and ask questions. I was referred to Ryan Vidischak by a friend. He took the time to come out and go over the insurance scope of work, answer all the questions and gave me an incredible price on upgrading to a premium roof. Highly recommend him and Cardinal roofing.

John went above and beyond to help with not only the gutter removal and then reinstall, but also with the insurance claim. He personally emailed and called our insurance agent, insurance adjuster, and met the adjuster on site.

name: Wood Kirk Works
text: Even though the staff seemed knowledgeable about the products offered here, the vibe of this business is pretentious to say the least. I came in with my girlfriend and her son. We came within 6 ft of several middle-aged employees and weren't greeted once. I had to approach the counter and ask for what I needed (which they didn't have) then I was left to my own devices finding anything else useful in the store. This could have been tolerable if it weren't for the same employees greeting other customers with warm, inviting hellos and good wishes.

resp.text: We apologize that you did not feel seen and appreciated in our store. We pride ourselves on customer service, whether its to contractors who come in every day or first time shoppers. We are fully open to the public and value our customers equally. We failed to demonstrate that. We hope you'll give us another opportunity to earn your business.

name: Jabaria Dent
text: Good customer service. And their wood prices beat Lowe's

resp.text: Thank you for this review. We hope this helps new customers know that, while we are not a global corporation like Lowe's, our prices are  very often lower than the big box stores.

name: A T
text: I ordered fence pickets from them, paid over phone, and had delivered a week later no problem. I call back a few days later to ask if I can get a few more and am told they haven't had any in weeks and I must be confused about who I got them from. I call back the next day and am told there's 30 left but they don't take payments over the phone. It sounds to me like the employees each have their own rules they go by 🙄

resp.text: Hi. We apologize for our poor communication. We should have done a better job explaining the fence board situation. The market for fence boards is extremely turbulent right now. We are accustomed to having a ready supply in stock and ordinarily we would be happy to take an order over the phone and hold the inventory. However, because fence boards are in such high demand and we haven't been able to source them with the dependability of the pre-COVID days, we are discouraging our staff from reserving them, because the last thing we want is a customer to pay for a product, expect it, and we not have it in stock when they are ready for delivery.

name: Andrew O'Dell
text: Good lumber at a good price, knowledgeable and very helpful staff.

name: Manuela Smith
text: Was disappointed by employees knowledge and selling me the wrong tool to fit the screws I bought there.

resp.text: Hi Manuela. We remember you coming in yesterday. We apologize for disappointing you. It's often difficult to discern the size of a screw or bolt from a cell phone image. We suggested a product that would work on a range of bolt sizes, but unfortunately we didn't guess right. Thank you for your business and again we are sorry we weren't able to help you select the right product the first time.

name: Ray Keene
text: Great customer service.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Mr. Keene. We appreciate your business.

text: Friendly environment, eager to assist, fast service.

name: Michelle Morgan
text:
We have been remodeling our home and I have been looking for a front door for about 2 months now with no luck and very little enthusiasm to sell me a door.  I happen to stumble across Mobile Lumber and Yvette was a breath of fresh air when it came to picking out the perfect front door.  She was very knowledgeable, nice, fast and her follow through was great.  Within 24 hours she had my pricing and order placed for me, even saved me a trip back to West Mobile by handling everything over the phone.  Excellent customer service, I only wish we would had checked Mobile Lumber out at the beginning of our remodel adventure.

Thanks so much Yvette,

Michelle Morgan

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words and for taking the time to give us this review. We appreciate it and so does Yvette. If there's anything else we can help you with in the future, please let us know.

name: Heather w
text: Went there a couple of Saturdays ago to look at front doors. Complete waste of time. We were not greeted when walking in, no one came over to assist us, or acknowledged us when we left. Not much selection out on the floor for what we were looking for and no customer service was offered.

resp.text: Hi Heather. We pride ourselves on our customer service, which is one factor that differentiates us from the big box stores. We failed to provide that experience to you and we apologize. Our team is very knowledgeable in exterior door options and we regret that we aren't able to help you select the perfect door for your home. We appreciate you coming in and hope you'll give us another chance.

name: 2SSRS 5th Gen
text: Prices are kinda high. But they also aren't MASKHOLES.

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We agree, lumber prices are on the high side right now, but that's across the industry. Lumber is a commodity and prices fluctuate daily (sometimes hourly) depending on the market. We value our reputation for pricing our building materials extremely competitively. It's part of what has kept us around since 1975.

name: OBrien Holcombe
text: This place has been here for decades and at least 4 of those decades I have used them for many project needs. Good folks, wonderful environment and the men in the yard do not get enough praise. So here is to you gentlemen for doing such an outstanding job day in and day out.

resp.text: Brien, we certainly appreciate your support and patronage over the past 4 decades! We will pass this praise along to our guys in the yard. If we can do anything to make your experience even better, please don't hesitate to let us know.

text: The folks there are really friendly and helpful. They don't have the amount of different stuff the Lowe's and home Depot have, but I would rather go there and check first for what I need.

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Ronnie. Let us know what you're looking for and we'll always be happy to help you find it, even if it's through another vendor, or we can often order it from our warehouse. See you soon!

name: Detroit Q
text: Some of the worst customer service I have ever experienced. I had never been to this place so I was unsure if customers were allowed to walk through the warehouse. Naturally I ask the clerk at the desk or at least tried to ask and when I say this guy gave the impression that he us too busy to deal with me. The guy wouldn't even stop typing or even give me the common decency of looking at me when he responded. At first I was thinking maybe I was asking to much due to me being a vet and being so use to people at least looking at you to acknowledge your existence but when he proceeded to continue typing and responding with very short answers I knew then it wasn't me. Everyone is entitled to a bad day and I get that but you work in the customer service industry for God sakes. A little hospitality would go a long way. I guess it's on to the next lumber yard.

name: Paul Miller
text: I shopped around and ended up doing my business here.  Well priced and very helpful

name: Mark James
text: Good place to get all your buildings needs

name: Katherine Winslow Austill
text:
The items I purchased were not available & what was available was not 1st quality.

None of the items offered for pick-up were straight & defect free.

I had to be very firm in my demand for a full refund.

The experience took over 1.5 hours to:
1) place the order
2) have the order hand written
3) pay for the order
4) drive around to pick up the order
5) walk inside and inform of the poor quality and insufficient quantity
6) walk back out to pick up to show inside sales the poor quality and insufficient quantity
7) walk back inside to ask - then demand a refund
8) wait while the entire order was again hand written and wait for my refund

A complete waste of time.
1.5 hours to accomplish nothing.

resp.text: Hi Katherine. We hate hearing that you had such a bad experience at our store! We are trying to track down your transaction to figure out what happened so it won't happen in the future. Providing an excellent customer service experience is very important to us! Would you be willing to talk to our store manager Lee to help us understand what happened? You can reach him at 661-8000. Again, we are sorry for any inconvenience we caused you.

name: Mike Coop
text:
From start to finish the entire roof replacement experience was seamless. Anthony Gioiosa did the initial inspection and recommended the roof be inspected by my insurance for possible hail damage and he was correct. He helped me process the claim and in a little over a month my roof was replaced. The roofers came and finished in one day. Amazing! Great Gob Cardinal Roofing. Will recommend to everyone who needs a roof replacement in the future.

I wanted to add to my first review, because I needed to add to how great my experience has been with Cardinal Roofing. I have had two roofs replaced now with Cardinal Roofing. Both were done with the same crew but a few months apart. The second roof was my personal house. The crew came early and worked hard all day long through hot temperatures, muggy conditions, and rain off and on. With only one small break in the middle for lunch the crew worked until they could see no more, then came the next day and finished the job up. The roof looks amazing. The crew worked with precision and accuracy that I have not seen before. I have had roof work done in the past to some of my rentals and the experience was not good. This time was different. From beginning to end I was treated with respect and valued as if they were replacing someone in their own family’s roof. Anthony Gioiosa, who is a representative for Cardinal Roofing, saw the job through from beginning to end, handled all of my concerns with professionalism and grace that has exceeded all of my expectations. I will be using Cardinal Roofing for all of my future roofing needs and will be recommending them in the future to everyone who needs roofing help. Great job Cardinal Roofing! I appreciate all of your exceptional work and dedication to excellence. God Bless.

resp.text: Thank you, Mike! Let us know if we can help in the future!

text: I decided to use Cardinal Roofing after 2 of my neighbors had their roof replaced by them, and I never regretted my decision.  Greg Cunningham was assigned as my contact person, and he was great.  Never had a problem reaching him with questions.  Never missed an appointment.  Easy person to deal with.  I would recommend Cardinal Roofing, and hopefully you'll get Greg as your contact person.

resp.text: We're glad you had a great experience, and we will be sure to pass along your kind words to Greg.  Thanks for sharing!

text: Our salesman Ernie Jonseof, delivered on every promise he made. There were 7 guys that started on my roof and had the job completed in a day and a half. They did a terrific job cleaning up after themselves. There was a quality control manager that came by the following day to pick up any unused materials and make sure the work was done properly. I would recommend Cardinal Roofing to anyone that needs a roof.

name: Charles Batchelor
text: Upon discover on a couple of leaks I called Cardinal roofing for repairs. I filed against my insurance company and cardinal roofing suggestion was to replace my roof. My insurance company agreed to pay for it and work started promptly and was completed quickly. After a few storms I noticed a leak in the same spot I originally filed for. Upon further inspection by Cardinal roofing it was discovered that roof in that spot was not replaced and was told it was in bad shape.  Now every storm I have to put towels down on my hardwood floors as no action has been taken since . I will change review if it gets fixed but as of now my hardwood floors are getting more water damage and drywall eventually will fall off ceiling.

text: It was a great experience from beginning to end. Anthony was my point of contact and went over everything with me to include advising me on the different materials, going over the contract, and letting  me know what to expect during the installation process. The installers did a great job and made sure the area was cleaned up. After the installation was complete Anthony came back and made sure I was satisfied with the job. I would recommend this company to anyone looking for any type of roof repair or replacement.

text:
My initial interaction with this company was not good but due to the issues and the explanation and correction of the misunderstanding I have decided to give Cardinal four stars on fixing the original issue. Thank you Ernie for contacting me and explaining the situation.

I hate negative reviews but due to the non-responsive and unprofessional approach to my roof project I felt like others should be aware. I signed a contract with Cardinal to fix my roof and a few weeks after signing I received a call from Ernie at Cardinal saying they could not replace the roof for the agreed and contract price (that they provided and signed). I asked for my deposit back and it was returned but they deducted a fee. I have tried to contact Ernie multiple times to ask why there was a deduction due to Cardinal not will to fulfill their obligation and he will not return my call. I have left many VM and text... no response. I would not recommend this company to anyone.

name: Sadie Goodman
text: I am so glad that I picked up the phone to call Cardinal Roofing to take a look at a roof leak I had adjacent to some skylights in my dining room. Jason Smith was always more than punctual, helpful with every step of the process, and laid out every minute detail for us as this was a roof for a multi-level 4,500 sq. ft. house. If it had not been for Jason Smith, we might not have our brand new roof in the fast amount of time it came together. He noticed extremely significant hail damage to my roof that likely meant replacing the entire roof. I was surprised that a roof on this size of a house could be completely torn off, plywood repaired or replaced, with all new shingles, flashing and vents put on in one single day, but that is what happened. A week later we were visited by inspector Mac, who answered questions I had concerning 2 spots on the roof where I saw some materials I had questions about. He got on the roof, took pictures, and came down to explain theses to me, and I was totally satisfied. It can be scary as a homeowner to take on such a massive and costly project, move the family and animals out of the house for a couple of days, and hope you've chosen the right company for the job. After my first meeting with Jason Smith I had no doubt that I could cancel all other roofing contractors I had called for appointments and go with Cardinal Roofing, due to his extreme efficiency, professionalism, and thorough knowledge of all aspects of the roof repair. From consulting with insurance (which he has immense amount of experience doing) to the step-by-step process of the installation, even down to telling me how and when to have my TV satellite dish reinstalled (and not on our beautiful new roof due to leaks/damage the bolts could cause), Jason brought us all information we never even knew we would need to know about a roof installation. Our satellite dish now lives happily installed in our yard on the ground. There was an army of persons installing our roof in 90 degree heat, and they worked very efficiently and very hard. Within 2 days after the roof was on and complete, someone had swept my entire property with large magnets to gather up roofing nails and other debris scattered about from the install. I did a thorough look over my driveway when I returned to make sure no nails were left that could cause my car to get a flat tire. They had gotten every single one. Within a week after the roof was completed all materials - extra tarp, shingle boxes, plywood, etc., were removed from my property by Cardinal Roofing. I cannot express enough that Jason Smith and those at Cardinal Roofing were professional, punctual, and always available to answer any question I had, via phone call or text message. Jason Smith is invaluable to the company. We are so grateful to give our house a much-needed update, better living for our family, more equity, a facelift due to a change of color from a dated orange roof, and most importantly, zero leaks. I am forever grateful to Jason and Cardinal Roofing and would highly, HIGHLY recommend them to anyone and everyone whoever asks me about a roofing job on any scale. Also, Jason never asked me himself, but I contacted him and insisted that he put a Cardinal Roofing sign in my yard when they were completed, so that others in the neighborhood knew who did this beautiful and very fast, excellent quality job on such a large house.

text: Great company with a great staff!   From the minute I contacted their office they were prompt and professional.  Daniel answered every question I had and explained the process of making an insurance claim thoroughly. name: Kevin Webb
text:
Awful company.   The actual work contracted, putting on the roof, I guess we'll see in the years to come but the behavior and ethics of this company are known and it is not a good story.  Originally they did not think the Insurance company was going to fully pay out the policy so they gave me a cash quote and fully expected to leave that in place after the insurance company decided to pay fully (after repeated harassing by me).    Mary Margaret spoke of it while standing in my front yard as the third inspection took place.   That even if they did decide to pay out fully that the original quote was valid and that we were "technically" committing fraud.  She had no issues with it, even mentioning that I would make out nicely.   I admit I was ignorant and perhaps complicit about learning the subtleties of the arrangement.   I got scared when I fully realized what was at stake and full disclosure was weighing my options at that point.  I had decided that 1500 bucks or whatever it was going to be was not worth the penalties and possible ramifications.  Cardinal needed to send in a completion certificate.  After avoiding my calls for two days Mary finally answered the phone.  I needed to know what they needed to send in the certificate and what was the final total given the insurance company estimate.  Mary encouraged me to call them and defraud them by telling them I could not wait for the certificate.   I immediately sent in the full amount to Cardinal as I knew at that moment Cardinal was without ethics and could not be trusted.  CYA was in full effect.    Then to put the cherry on top, they did send in the certificate but now my insurance company notified me that the full amount, or what I thought it was, was not correct.  That I had overpaid Cardinal.  My insurance company told me that, not Cardinal and they had no intention of telling me.  So I called them and let them know that I needed my refund immediately.  The owner, Jody, feigned ignorance and defiantly "objected" to my insinuation of impropriety.    The problem folks?   I have every text, every document and most importantly every phone call documented and recorded.  I have the audio.   This is not a question of right and wrong.  Cardinal was going to defraud my insurance company and complicit or not initially, I was not.  I was however not going to allow them to defraud me.  I would stay very far away from these people.  If you see them chasing ambulances in your neighborhood understand these people are not ethical nor honest.

Jody, I have the audio.  Feel free to ring me up and give me your email address.  I'll be happy to send you copies.

If you read this far and are confused at all the other positive reviews notice one thing.  They haven't responded to this review to refute it and I never heard another peep from them when they realized I had the proof.

Finally, look at the review profiles of the reviewers on here.  Lots of them Cardinal is their only review.  Doesn't take a genius to understand why.
